owl:Class.terms:description: Every thing is an entity.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: entity

owl:Class.terms:description: A process is an entity that is identifiable only through the unfolding of time, has temporal parts, and unless otherwise specified/predicted, cannot be identified from any instant of time in which it exists.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: process

owl:Class.terms:description: An emotion is a process (experience) that arises internally or from an involuntary physiological response to a stimulus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: emotion

owl:Class.terms:description: intent is a desire to realize a particular outcome.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: intent

owl:Class.terms:description: anger is disgust directed toward an equal status individual.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: anger

owl:Class.terms:description: Hate is a deep and emotional extreme dislike, directed against a certain object or class of objects.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hate

owl:Class.terms:description: love is an emotion of a strong affection and personal attachment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: love

owl:Class.terms:description: affection is an emotion characterized with a feeling or type of love for another living thing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: affection

owl:Class.terms:description: angst is the intense feeling of apprehension, anxiety or inner turmoil.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: angst

owl:Class.terms:description: Annoyance is an unpleasant emtion that is characterized by a abnormal or excessive sensitivity to some external stimulus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: annoyance

owl:Class.terms:description: anxiety is an emotion charactersized by intense feeling of fear and concern coupled with a physical response.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: anxiety

owl:Class.terms:description: apathy is an emotion characterized by lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: apathy

owl:Class.terms:description: arousal is an emotion characterized by state of reactive to stimuli. It involves the activation of the reticular activating system in the brain stem, the autonomic nervous system and the endocrine system, leading to increased heart rate and blood pressure and a condition of sensory alertness, mobility and readiness to respond.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: arousal

owl:Class.terms:description: awe is an emotion produced by that which is grand, sublime or powerful and is characterized by a combination of joy, fear and admiration/reverence/respect.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: awe

owl:Class.terms:description: boldness is the trait of being willing to undertake things that involve risk or danger.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: boldness

owl:Class.terms:description: boredom is the emotion experience by those not interested in their surroundings or available activities.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: boredom

owl:Class.terms:description: contempt is disgust towards a lower status individual.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: contempt

owl:Class.terms:description: contentment is an emotion characterized by acknowledgement and satisfaction of the current state of affairs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: contentment

owl:Class.terms:description: curiosity is the strong desire to know or learn something.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: curiosity

owl:Class.terms:description: depression is an unpleasant emotion linked to aversion to activity that can affect a person's thoughts, behavior, feelings and physical well-being. Depressed individuals may feel sad, anxious, empty, hopeless, worried, helpless, worthless, guilty, irritable, or restless.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: depression

owl:Class.terms:description: desire is a strong emotion of wanting to have something or wishing for something to happen.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: desire

owl:Class.terms:description: despair is depression, hopelessness or lack of hope.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: despair

owl:Class.terms:description: disappointment is the feeling of dissatisfaction that follows the failure of expectations or hopes to manifest.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: disappointment

owl:Class.terms:description: Disgust is a feeling of revulsion or profound disapproval aroused by something unpleasant or offensive.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: disgust

owl:Class.terms:description: dread is the instense negative emotion that induces fear and apprehension.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: dread

owl:Class.terms:description: ecstacy is an emotion characterized by a heightened state of consciousness with total involvement of a subject.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ecstasy

owl:Class.terms:description: A positive emotion is an emotion that feels good.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: positive emotion

owl:Class.terms:description: negative emotion is an emotion that does not feel good.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: negative emotion

owl:Class.terms:description: Embarrassment is the emotion of intense discomfort with oneself, experienced upon having a socially unacceptable act or condition witnessed by or revealed to other.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: embarassment

owl:Class.terms:description: envy is an emotion that occurs when a person lacks another's (perceived) superior quality, achievement or possession and wishes that the other lacked it.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: envy

owl:Class.terms:description: euphoria is an emotion characterized by intense feelings of well-being, elation, happiness, ecstasy, excitement, and joy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: euphoria

owl:Class.terms:description: excitement is a positive emotion of feeling great enthusiasm and eagerness.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: excitement

owl:Class.terms:description: Fear is a negative emotion induced by a perceived threat that induces one to hide or move quickly away from the location of the perceived threat.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: fear

owl:Class.terms:description: Frustration is an emotion that arises from the perceived resistance to the fulfillment of individual will.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: frustration

owl:Class.terms:description: Gratitude, thankfulness, gratefulness, or appreciation is a feeling, emotion or attitude in acknowledgment of a benefit that one has received or will receive.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: gratitude

owl:Class.terms:description: happiness is an emotion characterized by positive or pleasant emotions ranging from contentment to intense joy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: happiness

owl:Class.terms:description: Guilt is the emotion borne from feeling responsible for the commission of an offense and arises out of public humiliation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: guilt

owl:Class.terms:description: grief is an emotion in response to loss, whether physical or abstract including death, unemployment, ill health or the end of a relationship.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: grief

owl:Class.terms:description: hope is an emotion of belief in a positive outcome related to events and circumstances in one's life.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hope

owl:Class.terms:description: Hostility is the intense negative emotion of being in conflict or opposition to someone or something.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hostility

owl:Class.terms:description: hurt is an unpleasant feeling, emotion or sensation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hurt

owl:Class.terms:description: Hysteria is an unmanageable emotion.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hysteria

owl:Class.terms:description: indifference is an emotion characterized by lack of interest, concern, or sympathy.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: indifference

owl:Class.terms:description: interest is the emotion of wanting to know or learn about something or someone.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: interest

owl:Class.terms:description: jealousy is an emotion and typically refers to the negative thoughts and feelings of insecurity, fear, and anxiety over an anticipated loss of something that the person values, particularly in reference to a human connection.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: jealousy

owl:Class.terms:description: joy is an emotion of intense happiness.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: joy

owl:Class.terms:description: loathing is an intense dislike or disgust.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: loathing

owl:Class.terms:description: Loneliness is an unpleasant emotion in which a person feels a strong sense of emptiness, yearning distress and solitude resulting from inadequate quantity or quality of social relationships.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: loneliness

owl:Class.terms:description: lust is the strong desire for sex.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: lust

owl:Class.terms:description: misery is a feeling of great unhappiness, suffering and/or pain.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: misery

owl:Class.terms:description: Panic is a sudden emotion of fear which is so strong as to dominate or prevent reason and logical thinking, replacing it with overwhelming feelings of anxiety and frantic agitation consistent with an animalistic fight-or-flight reaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: panic

owl:Class.terms:description: passion is the intense desire for something.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: passion

owl:Class.terms:description: Pity is the emotion of sadness or sorrow for another.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pity

owl:Class.terms:description: pleasure is an emotion of happy satisfaction and enjoyment.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pleasure

owl:Class.terms:description: pride is an emotion of satisfaction of attachment toward one's own or another's choices and actions, or toward a whole group of people, and is a product of praise, independent self-reflection, or a fulfilled feeling of belonging.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pride

owl:Class.terms:description: Rage is a feeling of intense anger that is associated with the Fight-or-flight response.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: rage

owl:Class.terms:description: regret is a feeling of sadness, repentance, or disappointment over something that has happened or been done.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: regret

owl:Class.terms:description: remorse is an emotion of personal regret felt by a person after he or she has committed an act which they deem to be shameful, hurtful, or violent.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: remorse

owl:Class.terms:description: sadness is emotional pain associated with, or characterized by feelings of disadvantage, loss, despair, helplessness, sorrow, and rage.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sadness

owl:Class.terms:description: satisfaction is an emotion of fulfillment of one's wishes, expectations, or needs, or the pleasure derived from this.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: satisfaction

owl:Class.terms:description: shame is the emotion borne from feeling responsible for the commission of an offense.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: shame

owl:Class.terms:description: shock is an emotion of sudden upset or surprise.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: shock

owl:Class.terms:description: shyness is an emotion of apprehension, lack of comfort, or awkwardness experienced when in proximity to, approaching, or being approached by other individuals, especially in new situations or with unfamiliar individuals.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: shyness

owl:Class.terms:description: sorrow is the emotion that is characterized by a long term state of intense sadness, distress and a degree of resignation (not accepting).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: sorrow

owl:Class.terms:description: Suffering is the unpleasant emotion and aversion associated with the perception of harm or threat of harm in an individual.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: suffering

owl:Class.terms:description: surprise is a brief emotion experienced as the result of an unexpected event.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: surprise

owl:Class.terms:description: terror is the extreme feeling of fear.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: terror

owl:Class.terms:description: wonder is an emotion of perceiving something very rare or unexpected, but not threatening.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: wonder

owl:Class.terms:description: worry is the emotion characterized by concer over a real or imaginary issue.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: worry

owl:Class.terms:description: apprehension is the negative emotion that something unpleasant will occur.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: apprehension

owl:Class.terms:description: resentment is disgust directed toward a higher status individual.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: resentment

owl:Class.terms:description: Pain is an unpleasant sensory and emotional experience associated with actual or potential tissue damage, or described in terms of such damage.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: pain

owl:Class.terms:description: Behaviour is the set of actions and mannerisms made by systems (biological or otherwise) in response to stimuli or inputs, whether internal or external, conscious or subconscious, overt or covert, and voluntary or involuntary.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: behaviour

owl:Class.terms:description: Humiliation is the abasement of pride, which creates mortification or leads to a state of being humbled or reduced to lowliness or submission.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: humiliation

owl:Class.terms:description: hunger is the craving for food.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: hunger

owl:Class.terms:description: Discouragement is the emtion of having lost confidence or enthusiasm.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: discouragement

owl:Class.terms:description: satisfaction is the emotion of fulfillling one's wishes, expectations, or needs.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: satisfaction

owl:Class.terms:description: suicidal is the emotion of being deeply unhappy or depressed with thoughts of killing one's self.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: suicidal

owl:Class.terms:description: irritability is the negative emotion of quick excitability to annoyance, impatience, or anger.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: irritability

owl:Class.terms:description: indecision is the emotion of being unable to choose between two or more possible courses of action.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: indecision
